Label: IMPRESS Person
Description: A single individual

Label: Roles
Description: A survivor of an EOPHC

Label: Incident coordination
Description: The upper level coordination roles that a person may have during an emergency

Label: Incident coordination  level 2
Description: The lower lever coordination roles that a person may have during an emergency

Label: Administration  officer
Description: The indicators of the person’s health state

Label: Community  Relation officer
Description: The roles that a person may have during an emergency

Label: Command Group on scene
Description: In complex incidents or incidents over an extended time, a place of command is established from which this group can coordinate the operation.

Label: Affected
Description: A single individual which is affected by an EOPHC

Label: Non injured victims
Description: Usually accompany injured patients. A special area must be prepared for these victims with access to psychological support staff and information. Voluntary organizations are very useful.

Label: Injured
Description: Injured person can be described by ICD10-ICECI. Please, provide a range of codes.

Label: Severely injured patient
Description: Transported by ambulance, helicopter, car, relatives or other means. Taken care of by trauma teams, that usually consist of two or three physicians and three or four nurses, responsible for different functions

Label: Less severely injured patients
Description: Usually come by ambulance, car, relatives or walking: must be carefully examined by doctor and nurse. Cannot be sent home, also because of psychological trauma, may be admitted to wards for further medical treatment. Must meet psychological support operators

Label: Expectant
Description: Blue tag, T4: this category is activated in case of MCS: the patients with low survival probability or who are beyond the scope of survival receive only palliative care. They are not treated non transported.

Label: Physiological Lesions
Description: Physiological injuries resulting from anatomical lesions

Label: mediastinal vein compression
Description: compression of the mediastinal vein

Label: internal organs damage
Description: damage of internal organs

Label: pelvic organs damage
Description: damage of pelvic organs

Label: volume decrease
Description: decrease in circulatory volume

Label: mediastinal pressure
Description: rise in mediastinal pressure

Label: CAD
Description: Cervical acceleration-deceleration (CAD)

Label: toxic contamination
Description: contamination by toxic substance/radiation

Label: Anatomical  Lesions
Description: Any anatomical lesion resulting from trauma

Label: material
Description: blood, secretion, aspirated gastrointestinal content, dislocated teeth or dental protheses, or foreign material

Label: edema
Description: Is this the same as P2.1.1.2.6.2.7 ?

Label: retracted tongue
Description: retracted tongue cused by reduced muscular tension in unconscious patient

Label: concussion brain
Description: concussion/contusion brain

Label: hemorrhage
Description: Subarachnoid, subdural, and extradural hemorrhage

Label: respiratorycenter injury
Description: injury to the respiratorycenter of the brain

Label: tracheal lesion
Description: tracheal lesion/emphisema (Classificazione di Schaefer Fuhrman)

Label: blunt lesion
Description: blunt lesion/contusion of the chest wall

Label: lungs injuries
Description: injuries (bleeding/air leaking) of the lungs

Label: lung toxic injury
Description: lung injury caused by toxic gases

Label: vertebral column trauma
Description: trauma of the vertebral column

Label: respiratory center injury
Description: injury to the respiratory center caused by shock or lack of oxygen

Label: tachycardia
Description: supraventricular and ventricular tachycardia, flutter or ventricular fibrillation

Label: Radiation effect
Description: Effect of radiation, unspecified

Label: State indicators
Description: The state indicators can be given by the ICF? Please, provide a range of codes, if possible

Label: Dead victims
Description: Must be transferred to a prepared area

Label: Animals
Description: An animal that may be affected by an EOPHC
